newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Cimpor seen priced around 3,200 escudos.
newsitem.headline: Cimpor seen priced around 3,200 escudos.

text.p: The privatisation price of cement group Cimpor-Cimentos de Portugal is expected to be between 3,150 and 3,250 escudos per share, below the 3,290 at which it was trading on Wednesday, analysts said.
Analysts based their forecasts on the experience of the recently-privatised Portugal Telecom where the price was fixed at around two percent below the market price on the preceeding day.
The forecast assumed that Cimpor remained stable in the run-up to the announcement of the price on October 15, they added.

The price of the privatisation, in which the government is floating off a further 45 percent, partly through book building and partly through a public offer to sell (OPV), will be announced at a special bourse session.
The price of the OPV will either be that of the direct sale or a recent average of the share price plus five percent, whichever is lower.
Demand at the pre-registration for the 16 million shares being sold at the OPV exceeded the offer by around five times.
